intro: Lithospermum callosum, commonly known as the hairy rock pepper, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale purple to deep red, blooming in summer. Its root system is fibrous and contains compounds that have been used in traditional medicine. Lithospermum callosum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
